channel.title: My server is online but cant connect?
channel.description:
ok sorry if this is the easiest thing to do in the world but ive made 3 servers in the past and theyve been fine. i just made this server today and when i try to connect to my server i made (agscape.no-ip.info) it says error connecting to server as if it was offline but i put it online and also compiled it completely fine.
edit:i can connect using localhost.
please help
~thanks, gavin[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 03, 2009, 10:07:16 pm[/size][hr]i really need help guys please respond

item.title: My server is online but cant connect?
item.dc:creator: @paintball10 paintball10
item.description:
@paintball10 wrote:

Error: I could not see your service on 72.197…not going to add rest of the ip on port (43594)
Reason: Connection refused[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 04, 2009, 05:42:01 pm[/size][hr]with my last post yes it says pklegends cuz i tried changing it to my old server to see if it would make a differnce

Read full topic

item.title: My server is online but cant connect?
item.dc:creator: @Your_Master Your Master
item.description:
@Your_Master wrote:

Go on canyouseeme.org and in the box type inn 43594 and press check then down it will say: Error & Succes. If it says Error, try show me a pic the portforwarding.

Read full topic
item.source: My server is online but cant connect?

item.title: My server is online but cant connect?
item.dc:creator: @paintball10 paintball10
item.description:
@paintball10 wrote:

im using 43594 from when i went to windows firewall>
exceptions>
add port>
agscape>
43594>
TCP>
ok

ive never had to do the portforward in any of my servers so…i dont think its portforwarding please keep replying guys i still need help ill give u admin if u get it working

port.jpg1024×819

Read full topic

item.title: My server is online but cant connect?
item.dc:creator: @mitchtheblonde mitchtheblonde
item.description:
@mitchtheblonde wrote:

are you using a different port? if so you might need to reconfigure your forwarded ports on your router.
